intro: Macrosolen psilanthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved macrolen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like芋头 and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
